thread.title: PHOTO GALLERY: Daniel Murphy's 7 postseason home runs
thread.title_full: PHOTO GALLERY: Daniel Murphy's 7 postseason home runs

title: PHOTO GALLERY: Daniel Murphy's 7 postseason home runs
text:
Updated: 12:02 p.m. Thursday, Oct. 22, 2015 | Posted: 12:01 p.m. Thursday, Oct. 22, 2015 PHOTO GALLERY: Daniel Murphy's 7 postseason home runs Related View Larger FILE - At left, in this Oct. 9, 2015, file photo, New York Mets' Daniel Murphy watches his first 2015 postseason home run, against the Los Angeles Dodgers during the fourth inning in Game 1 of baseball's National League Division Series in Los Angeles. At right, also in an Oct. 9, 2015, file photo, Mets' Daniel Murphy celebrates his solo home run as Dodgers catcher A.J. Ellis looks down during the fourth inning in Game 1 of baseball's National League Division Series in Los Angeles. Murphy won NL Championship Series MVP on Wednesday night, Oct. 21, 2015, after homering for a postseason-record sixth straight game, leading the Mets over the Chicago Cubs 8-3 to complete a four-game sweep. (AP Photo/File) View Larger FILE - On top, in this Oct. 13, 2015, file photo, New York Mets' Daniel Murphy connects for his second 2015 postseason home run, against the Los Angeles Dodgers during the fourth inning of baseball's Game 4 of the National League Division Series in New York. On bottom, also in an Oct. 13, 2015, file photo, Mets' Daniel Murphy rounds the bases after hitting the solo home run against the Dodgers during the fourth inning of baseball's Game 4 of the National League Division Series in New York. Murphy won NL Championship Series MVP on Wednesday night, Oct. 21, 2015, after homering for a postseason-record sixth straight game, leading the Mets over the Chicago Cubs 8-3 to complete a four-game sweep. (AP Photo/File) View Larger FILE - At left, in an Oct. 15, 2015, file photo, New York Mets' Daniel Murphy watches his third 2015 postseason home run, during the sixth inning in Game 5 of baseball's National League Division Series against the Los Angeles Dodgers in Los Angeles. At right, also in an Oct. 15, 2015, file photo, Mets' Daniel Murphy reacts after hitting the home run during the sixth inning in Game 5 of baseball's National League Division Series against the Dodgers in Los Angeles. Murphy won NL Championship Series MVP on Wednesday night, Oct. 21, 2015, after homering for a postseason-record sixth straight game, leading the Mets over the Chicago Cubs 8-3 to complete a four-game sweep. (AP Photo/Lenny Ignelzi, File) View Larger FILE - On top, in an Oct. 17, 2015, file photo, New York Mets' Daniel Murphy hits his fourth 2015 postseason home run, during the first inning of Game 1 of the National League baseball championship series against the Chicago Cubs in New York. On bottom, also in an Oct. 17, 2015, file photo, Mets' Daniel Murphy (28) is congratulated by teammate Travis d'Arnaud after hitting the home run during the first inning of Game 1 of the National League baseball championship series against the Cubs in New York. (AP Photo/File) View Larger FILE - On top, in this Oct. 18, 2015, file photo, New York Mets' Daniel Murphy hits his fifth 2015 postseason home run, during the first inning of Game 2 of the National League baseball championship series against the Chicago Cubs in New York. Below, also in an Oct. 18, 2015, file photo, Mets' Daniel Murphy celebrates after hitting the two-run home run during the first inning of Game 2 of the National League baseball championship series against the Cubs in New York. Murphy won NL Championship Series MVP on Wednesday night, Oct. 21, 2015, after homering for a postseason-record sixth straight game, leading the Mets over the Chicago Cubs 8-3 to complete a four-game sweep. (AP Photo/File) View Larger FILE - At left, in an Oct. 20, 2015, file photo, New York Mets' Daniel Murphy celebrates after hitting his sixth 2015 postseason home run, during the third inning of Game 3 of the National League baseball championship series against the Chicago Cubs in Chicago. At right, Mets' Daniel Murphy hits the home run during the third inning of Game 3 of the National League baseball championship series against the Cubs in Chicago. Murphy won NL Championship Series MVP on Wednesday night, Oct. 21, 2015, after homering for a postseason-record sixth straight game, leading the Mets over the Chicago Cubs 8-3 to complete a four-game sweep. (AP Photo/File) View Larger FILE - At top, in an Oct. 21, 2015, file photo, New York Mets' Daniel Murphy hits his seventh 2015 postseason home run, during the eighth inning of Game 4 of the National League baseball championship series against the Chicago Cubs in Chicago. Below, Mets' Daniel Murphy celebrates after hitting the two-run home run during the eighth inning of Game 4 of the National League baseball championship series against the Chicago Cubs in Chicago. (AP Photo/File) Sponsored Links The Associated Press NEW YORK â€” 
Daniel Murphy, who had 14 home runs during the regular season, has seven during the postseason to help the New York Mets reach the World Series for the first time since 2000. His total is one shy of the postseason record shared by Barry Bonds (2002), Carlos Beltran (2004) and Nelson Cruz (2011), and Murphy has set a major league record by homering in six consecutive postseason games.
